alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Henderson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 11:52AM EST until January 16 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Indiana...Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, and Shawneetown. .Heavy rainfall and recent snow melt led to the current flooding on the Ohio River. Water levels are forecast to drop below flood stage at points along the river this weekend to early next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Newburgh Dam. * WHEN...Until late Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 38.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a secondary crest of 39.6 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
